channel.title: "sdram overflowed" question
channel.description: Hello, I have nine 16b sdram load objects in a patch (only these 9 objects, nothing else, just for testing) each of them with a size of 524288. And the console shows up an error that the sdram is overflowed by 1048576 bytes. I don't understand why this error since the total sdram of my objects is 9 X 524288 = 4718592, 4.7Mo. Axoloti has 8Mo of SDRAM so I am under the limit. Any idea?

item.title: "sdram overflowed" question
item.dc:creator: @berzelius
item.description:
@berzelius wrote:

Thanks! (bit/byte I'm always confused :()

Read full topic

item.title: "sdram overflowed" question
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

16b = 2 bytes, so about right

Read full topic

item.title: "sdram overflowed" question
item.dc:creator: @berzelius
item.description:
@berzelius wrote:

Hello,
I have nine 16b sdram load objects in a patch (only these 9 objects, nothing else, just for testing) each of them with a size of 524288. And the console shows up an error that the sdram is overflowed by 1048576 bytes.
I don't understand why this error since the total sdram of my objects is 9 X 524288 = 4718592, 4.7Mo. Axoloti has 8Mo of SDRAM so I am under the limit. Any idea?

Read full topic
